title: RTX 4060 Ti vs RX 6900 XT - is it any match?
text: Can Nvidia's newest release take on one of AMD's most prized GPU offerings Reviewed By: Kevin Pocock PC Guide is reader-supported. Prices subject to change. Read More Last Updated on March 8, 2024 As it braces for the debut of the Nvidia GeForce RTX 4060 Ti, the tech world is abuzz with curiosity pondering how this new 40-series offering will measure up against the competition. Among contenders is one AMD Radeon RX graphics card that proves promising, a high-performing GPU that has been making waves in the market. The RTX 4060 Ti vs RX 6900 XT bout will be an interesting perspective on how far GPU innovation has come. This article will explore a direct comparison between the two components, focusing on their rumored and actual specs, respectively. The current RTX 4060 Ti specs provide an intriguing glimpse into its capabilities and how it might stack up against the esteemed RX 6900 XT. We strongly recommend reading our RTX 4060 Ti review next. First off, the 160W of Total Board Power on the RTX 4060 Ti is significantly lower than the RX 6900 XT’s 300W. This disparity showcases the efficiency that Nvidia aims to achieve with its newer 40-series GPUs, an aspect that could appeal to users who want to leverage less power consumption and heat generation. Shop on Amazon Shop on Amazon Clock speed is another area where we see differences. The RX 6900 XT’s boost clock of 2015 MHz falls short of the 4060 Ti’s rumored 2535 MHz, suggesting that the latter could offer faster on-the-spot performance. Moving on to core counts, the RX 6900 XT, with its 5120 CUDA cores, surpasses the RTX 4060 Ti’s 4352. This indicates that the RX 6900 XT can handle more parallel computations, an advantage in demanding tasks and games. Definitively, the extra cores of the 6900 XT add up to the larger memory bandwidth, making up for the lower clock speed. In this comparison, it’s clear how AMD manages to deliver a faster and more efficient GPU. Nonetheless, this is a competition between a powerhouse and a low mid-range GPU, and, although the generational gap between both is clear, the amount of resources the AMD part has clearly marked the difference. The price comparison between the rumored RTX 4060 Ti and AMD’s RX 6900 XT is quite stark. The RX 6900 XT, AMD’s top-of-the-line GPU, has a retail price of $999, which is significantly higher than the $399 8GB option and $499 16GB RTX 4060 Ti. Despite this, the RX 6900 XT is aimed at the higher end of the market, with features and FPS performance that cater to demanding gamers and professionals. On the other hand, the RTX 4060 Ti is a mid-range card, targeting casual gamers and those with a more constrained budget. Thus, while the RX 6900 XT offers superior performance at higher settings and at a higher resolution, the RTX 4060 Ti might be a more cost-effective option for those who don’t require the highest level of GPU performance. The AMD RX 6900 XT remains a heavy-hitter in the GPU market, even if it’s from the previous generation. Designed for high-performance tasks and excellent 4K gaming, it was built to go toe-to-toe with top-tier Nvidia GPUs. Its impressive array of cores, the clock speeds it can hit, and its sizable memory all contribute to making it a formidable contender. When placed side by side with the rumored specs of the RTX 4060 Ti, it’s clear that the RX 6900 XT maintains an advantage in terms of raw power. However, it does lack one critical feature that Nvidia GPUs have capitalized on – DLSS 3.0. This absence could potentially give the 4060 Ti an edge in particular gaming scenarios, where DLSS 3.0 can boost performance substantially. In contrast, the 4060 Ti, while it might not match the 6900 XT in terms of sheer power, still promises to deliver solid performance for 1080p and 1440p gaming. The addition of DLSS 3.0 to its feature list could result in smooth, responsive gaming experiences even when the hardware is pushed. For those who are budget-conscious but still want to enjoy the perks of new-gen features, the 4060 Ti could be a compelling option. Wrapping things up, the RX 6900 XT, being a powerhouse from AMD’s previous generation, delivers a powerful performance that’s difficult to surpass. Its superior specs and AMD’s impressive price-to-performance ratio make it a formidable competitor. On the other hand, the 4060 Ti, albeit being a mid-range GPU, brings in new-gen features like DLSS 3.0 and ray tracing 3.0. However, when it comes to raw performance, the RX 6900 XT reigns supreme. So, if you’re on the hunt for more power, the 6900 XT is a compelling choice. f you want raw power and top-of-the-line performance, the RX 6900 XT is the way to go. However, if you’re interested in new-gen features like DLSS 3.0 and ray tracing 3.0, and a balance between price and performance, the 4060 Ti could be a good choice.
